title: 'Anti-memorials' honor Indian Partition's unseen victims, 75 years on
description: Through quiet but searing installations, artist Pritika Chowdhry reckons with violence that ripples through generations: mass displacement, rape and riots tracing back to the snaking borders that split a nation. For 15 years, she has made artworks based on the partition of British India into an independent India and Pakistan in 1947, as well as the bloody nationalist conflict that followed in East Pakistan, which cleaved off to become Bangladesh in 1971.

title: Author Salman Rushdie in surgery after being stabbed; authorities identify suspect
Search warrant for Trump home identifies 3 possible crimes as reasoning, including Espionage Act violations
FBI took 11 sets of highly classified documents from Mar-a-Lago
description: The FBI recovered 11 sets of classified documents from its search of Mar-a-Lago earlier this week, including some materials marked as "top secret/SCI," The Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.

title: 11 killed, including 2 children, in Montenegro gun attack, state media report
description: At least 11 people were killed, including two children, in a deadly mass shooting in Montenegro's southern city of Cetinje on Friday, according to state media RTCG.

title: FBI took 11 sets of classified documents from Mar-a-Lago, including some at highest classification levels
Key lines from the FBI's search warrant and receipt
description: A federal judge on Friday unsealed the search warrant and property receipt from the FBI search of former President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort in Palm Beach, Florida.

title: Honig breaks down what we know so far about Trump search warrant
description: CNN's legal analyst Elie Honig details what's known so far about the FBI's warrant authorizing a search of former President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate.

title: Analysis: We thought Murdoch's news outlets were abandoning Trump. Then the FBI searched Mar-a-Lago
description: If nothing else can be said with certainty about Donald Trump after a week of coverage filled with speculation about the purpose of the FBI search at Mar-a-Lago, it is that he still has the biggest cable TV news channel, Fox News, solidly behind him. He also has the editorial boards of The Wall Street Journal and New York Post, two other major platforms owned by Rupert Murdoch, on his side so far.

title: Must-watch videos of the week
FBI standoff suspect made posts on Trump's social media platform
description: An account bearing the name of Ricky Shiffer, the man authorities say they killed after he tried Thursday to breach an FBI field office in Cincinnati, made posts on the social media platform founded by Donald Trump referencing the attempt to storm the office and encouraging others online to prepare for a revolutionary-type war.

title: Watch flooding in northern China sweep away cars
description: Search and rescue efforts are ongoing for several missing people as China's Shanxi province was hit by record rainfall, according to Chinese state media CCTV.

title: Tommy Lee's nude photo sparks accusations of double standards
description: Rocker Tommy Lee posted a nude photo on social media -- but not everyone is applauding.

title: Do you have 'eco-anxiety'? Here's how to find out
description: Author and former CNN meteorologist Bonnie Schneider shares experts' advice on how to cope with "eco-anxiety," the unease that people experience over climate change and the future of the planet.

title: Let's talk about royal titles
description: With the summer well and truly upon us and most of the Windsor clan taking a brief break, we thought we'd use the opportunity to take a look at royal titles.

title: Why a hostage-taker in Lebanon was hailed as a national hero
description: A dramatic series of events unfolded on a bustling street in Beirut on Thursday when an armed man barged into a bank and held employees and customers hostage. He wasn't trying to rob the bank -- he was demanding his own money back.

title: The Rhine is shrinking, endangering Europe's top economy
description: Germany's Rhine river is getting too dry, snarling supply chains and creating more problems for its struggling economy.

title: Cause of Crimea blasts is unclear. But analysts say Russia suffered a significant loss
A referee collapsed during a basketball game. See what happened next
description: A firefighter playing basketball goes beyond the call of duty and helps save a referee who collapsed during the game. CNN's Alexandra Field reports.

title: The organization providing free travel experiences to Black women with cancer
description: When their sister Maria died from breast cancer in 2019, Alicia and Esther Tambe were determined to honor her in a way that would truly encapsulate the person she was.

title: Raheem Sterling didn't think twice about joining Chelsea despite racist incident in 2018
description: Raheem Sterling says he didn't think twice about joining Chelsea this season despite receiving racist abuse at Stamford Bridge previously in his career.

title: Millions in England to face garden watering bans as drought declared
description: Large swaths of England have officially descended into drought, authorities announced Friday, urging residents and businesses in affected areas to conserve water in the driest summer in 50 years.

title: How Google found itself under pressure from all sides after Roe's demise
description: In mid-June, one week before the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, more than 20 Congressional Democrats wrote a letter to Google CEO Sundar Pichai. In it, they urged the company to prevent searches for abortion clinics from returning results and ads that direct users to facilities that actually oppose the procedure, noting it could put women's health at risk.

title: Kenya electoral officials blame presidential candidates' agents for results delay
description: Kenya's electoral officials on Friday blamed the delay in announcing the result of the country's presidential election on candidates' agents for slowing down the national tally of votes.

title: Take a global tour of the world's best frozen treats
description: As the summer heat builds, we couldn't help but wonder: Is there anybody in the world who doesn't love ice cream?

title: Johnson & Johnson will stop selling talc-based baby powder around the world in 2023
description: Johnson & Johnson is abandoning talc-based baby powder next year and instead will make it with cornstarch.

title: Supergiant Betelgeuse had a never-before-seen massive eruption
description: The red supergiant Betelgeuse, a colossal star in the Orion constellation, experienced a massive stellar eruption -- the likes of which have never been seen before, according to astronomers.

title: Look of the Week: Did Kylie Jenner channel another famous Kylie?
description: Kylie Jenner has made a strong case for glamorous party tops, channeling a disco ball and another famous Kylie, singer Kylie Minogue, at once.

title: Tom Brady taking leave of absence from team to 'deal with personal things'
description: Tom Brady is taking some time away from the Tampa Bay Buccaneers to "deal with personal things," according to the team's head coach Todd Bowles.

title: 'Moon Man' is just what China's box office needs after months of lockdowns
NBA to retire Bill Russell's No. 6 jersey throughout the league as tribute to the 11-time champion
description: The National Basketball Association (NBA) announced on Thursday it will permanently retire Basketball Hall of Famer Bill Russell's No.6 jersey throughout the league.

title: Argentina hikes interest rates to 69.5% as inflation hits 20-year high
description: Argentina's central bank raised its benchmark interest rate by 950 basis points on Thursday as the country struggles to keep a lid on spiraling inflation that rose to a 20-year high of 71%, according to new data.

title: South Korea pardons Samsung's Jay Y Lee in bid to revive the economy
description: The de facto leader of Samsung, Lee Jae-yong, was pardoned by South Korea's president on Friday for crimes including bribery, allowing him greater freedom to run the smartphone and semiconductor giant.

title: Beijing is mad about Pelosi's visit to Taiwan. But now some Chinese are thanking her
description: US House Speaker Pelosi may have left Taiwan, but the retaliation from China is only beginning. Beijing is staging what it claims the largest ever military drills around Taiwan that simulate a blockade. Some in China thank Pelosi for her "helping hand" in what would soon be the "unification" of the "motherland."

title: Italians have hilarious reaction to pizza giant's exit from Italy
description: Domino's has formally shut its stores in Italy after seven years in the country, according to a report by Milano Today.

title: Koreans drown in bunkers built 50 years ago to save lives
description: Seoul has vowed to move some of the city's poorest families out of underground and semi-subterranean homes after 11 people were killed in flooding caused by record-breaking rainfall this week, sparking public horror and calls for government accountability.

title: Ecovado could be a greener alternative to 'green gold'
description: Often referred to as "green gold," the avocado has soared in popularity in recent years. Eleven billion pounds of the fruit are consumed annually around the world according to the World Economic Forum.

title: Critical questions must be answered on China's new Langya virus, scientists say
description: More surveillance is needed of a new virus detected in dozens of people in eastern China that may not cause the next pandemic but suggests just how easily viruses can travel unnoticed from animals to humans, scientists say.

title: Hong Kong suffers biggest ever population drop as exodus accelerates
description: Hong Kong has recorded its sharpest annual drop in population, with experts blaming the decline on strict Covid control measures and a political crackdown that have taken the shine off a financial hub long advertised as "Asia's world city."

title: Ukraine is telling people in this city to flee, but many are not listening
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has told citizens they need to leave eastern Ukraine, because they can't be supported through winter. Yet some residents are not leaving even in places where the shelling is heaviest. CNN's Nic Robertson has more.

title: Armed suspect who tried to enter FBI office in Cincinnati is dead after standoff
